item.description:
Hey Folks,

At Mike's last meeting with us, we discussed his thesis that the world (and therefore the mind) is ultimately computable. Unfortunately, the planned follow-up meeting got delayed, so I propose we make that up this time round.

In breaking with the tradition of me beng the neutral moderator, and just to start us off, I'd like to present my own very partisan case for the counter-thesis. Anyone else who wants to present this counter-thesis with me, let me know and we can try to organize it. As always, it's just a framework for the usual free-for-all that follows.

And as usual, let me know who's in for pizza.

See you there
Sean

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: Computability of the Mind: Round II
